registers.name: AIN#(0:254)
registers.description: Returns the voltage of the specified analog input.

registers.name: DAC#(0:1)
registers.description: Pass a voltage for the specified analog output.

registers.name: FIO#(0:7)
registers.description: Read or set the state of 1 bit of digital I/O.  Also configures the direction to input or output. Read 0=Low AND 1=High. Write 0=Low AND 1=High.

registers.name: EIO#(0:7)
registers.description: Read or set the state of 1 bit of digital I/O.  Also configures the direction to input or output. Read 0=Low AND 1=High. Write 0=Low AND 1=High.

registers.name: CIO#(0:3)
registers.description: Read or set the state of 1 bit of digital I/O.  Also configures the direction to input or output. Read 0=Low AND 1=High. Write 0=Low AND 1=High.

registers.name: MIO#(0:2)
registers.description: Read or set the state of 1 bit of digital I/O.  Also configures the direction to input or output. Read 0=Low AND 1=High. Write 0=Low AND 1=High.

registers.name: FIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 8 bits of FIO in a single binary-encoded value. 0=Low AND 1=High.  Does not configure direction.  Reading lines set to output returns the current logic levels on the terminals, not necessarily the output states written.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: EIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 8 bits of EIO in a single binary-encoded value. 0=Low AND 1=High.  Does not configure direction.  Reading lines set to output returns the current logic levels on the terminals, not necessarily the output states written.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: CIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 4 bits of CIO in a single binary-encoded value. 0=Low AND 1=High.  Does not configure direction.  Reading lines set to output returns the current logic levels on the terminals, not necessarily the output states written.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: MIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 3 bits of MIO in a single binary-encoded value. 0=Low AND 1=High.  Does not configure direction.  Reading lines set to output returns the current logic levels on the terminals, not necessarily the output states written.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: FIO_EIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 16 bits of FIO-EIO in a single binary-encoded value. 0=Low AND 1=High.  Does not configure direction.  Reading lines set to output returns the current logic levels on the terminals, not necessarily the output states written.

registers.name: EIO_CIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 12 bits of EIO-CIO in a single binary-encoded value. 0=Low AND 1=High.  Does not configure direction.  Reading lines set to output returns the current logic levels on the terminals, not necessarily the output states written. As of firmware 1.0172, MIO states are included in the upper nibble of the CIO byte.

registers.name: CIO_MIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 12 bits of CIO-MIO in a single binary-encoded value. 0=Low AND 1=High.  Does not configure direction.  Reading lines set to output returns the current logic levels on the terminals, not necessarily the output states written.

registers.name: FIO_DIRECTION
registers.description: Read or write the direction of the 8 bits of FIO in a single binary-encoded value.  0=Input and 1=Output.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: EIO_DIRECTION
registers.description: Read or write the direction of the 8 bits of EIO in a single binary-encoded value.  0=Input and 1=Output.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: CIO_DIRECTION
registers.description: Read or write the direction of the 4 bits of CIO in a single binary-encoded value.  0=Input and 1=Output.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: MIO_DIRECTION
registers.description: Read or write the direction of the 3 bits of MIO in a single binary-encoded value.  0=Input and 1=Output.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: DIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of all digital I/O in a single binary-encoded value. 0=Low AND 1=High. Does not configure direction.  A read of an output returns the current logic level on the terminal, not necessarily the output state written.  Writes are filtered by the value in DIO_INHIBIT.

registers.name: DIO_DIRECTION
registers.description: Read or write the direction of all digital I/O in a single binary-encoded value.  0=Input and 1=Output.  Writes are filtered by the value in DIO_INHIBIT.

registers.name: DIO_ANALOG_ENABLE
registers.description: Read or write the analog configuration of all digital I/O in a single binary-encoded value.  1=Analog mode and 0=Digital mode. When switching from analog to digital, the lines will be set to input. Writes are filtered by the value in DIO_INHIBIT.

registers.name: DIO_PULLUP_DISABLE
registers.description: This register will prevent pullups from being enabled on lines set to digital input. This is a binary coded value where bit 0 represent FIO0 and bit 11 represents EIO3. 1 = pullup disabled, 0 = pullup enabled. This register only affects flex-lines which can be configured as analog or digital. This register is not affected by the inhibit register.

registers.name: DIO_INHIBIT
registers.description:
A single binary-encoded value where each bit determines whether _STATE, _DIRECTION or _ANALOG_ENABLE writes affect that bit of digital I/O.
0=Default=Affected,
1=Ignored.

registers.name: LED_COMM
registers.description: Sets the state of the COMM LED when the LEDs are set to manual, see the POWER_LED register.

registers.name: LED_STATUS
registers.description: Sets the state of the STATUS LED when the LEDs are set to manual, see the POWER_LED register.

registers.name: STREAM_SCANRATE_HZ
registers.description: Write a value to specify the number of times per second that all channels in the stream scanlist will be read.  Max stream speeds are based on Sample Rate which is NumChannels*ScanRate.  Has no effect when using and external clock.  A read of this register returns the actual scan rate, which can be slightly different due to rounding.  For scan rates >152.588, the actual scan interval is multiples of 100 ns.  Assuming a core clock of 80 MHz the internal roll value is (80M/(8*DesiredScanRate))-1 and the actual scan rate is then 80M/(8*(RollValue+1).  For slower scan rates the scan interval resolution is changed to 1 us, 10 us, 100 us, or 1 ms as needed to achieve the longer intervals.

registers.name: STREAM_NUM_ADDRESSES
registers.description: The number of entries in the scanlist

registers.name: STREAM_SAMPLES_PER_PACKET
registers.description: Specifies the number of data points to be sent in the data packet. Only applies to spontaneous mode.

registers.name: STREAM_SETTLING_US

devices.description: The T7 will select the settling time based on resolution and gain settings. When the sample rate is above 60 kHz, settling time will be set to ~5 us. Max is 4400.
The T4 will default to 10 us. When the scan rate is above 20 kHz, settling time will be set to 5 us.

registers.description: Time in microseconds to allow signals to settle after switching the mux. Does not apply to the 1st channel in the scan list, as that settling is controlled by scan rate (the time from the last channel until the start of the next scan). Default=0. When set to less than 1, automatic settling will be used. The automatic settling behavior varies by device.

registers.name: STREAM_RESOLUTION_INDEX

devices.description: Valid values: 0-8. Default value of 0 corresponds to an index of 1.
Valid values: 0-5. Default value of 0 corresponds to an index of 1.

registers.description: The resolution index for stream readings. A larger resolution index generally results in lower noise and longer sample times.

registers.name: STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE_BYTES

devices.description: Max size is 32768. Default size is 8192.
Max size is 32768. Default size is 4096.

registers.description: Size of the stream data buffer in bytes. A value of 0 equates to the default value.  Must be a power of 2. Size in samples is STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE_BYTES/2.  Size in scans is (STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE_BYTES/2)/STREAM_NUM_ADDRESSES. Changes while stream is running do not affect the currently running stream.

registers.name: STREAM_CLOCK_SOURCE
registers.description:
Controls which clock source will be used to run the main stream clock.
0 = Internal crystal,
2 = External clock source on CIO3.
Rising edges will increment a counter and trigger a stream scan after the number of edges specified in STREAM_EXTERNAL_CLOCK_DIVISOR. T7 will expect external stream clock on CIO3. All other values reserved.

registers.name: STREAM_AUTO_TARGET
registers.description:
Controls where data will be sent. Value is a bitmask.
bit 0: 1 = Send to Ethernet 702 sockets,
bit 1: 1 = Send to USB,
bit 4: 1 = Command-Response mode.
All other bits are reserved.

registers.name: STREAM_NUM_SCANS
registers.description: The number of scans to run before automatically stopping (stream-burst). 0 = run continuously. Limit for STREAM_NUM_SCANS is 2^32-1, but if the host is not reading data as fast as it is acquired you also need to consider STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE_BYTES.

registers.name: STREAM_EXTERNAL_CLOCK_DIVISOR
registers.description: The number of pulses per stream scan when using an external clock.

registers.name: STREAM_TRIGGER_INDEX
registers.description:
Controls when stream scanning will start.
0 = Start when stream is enabled,
2000 = Start when DIO_EF0 detects an edge,
2001 = Start when DIO_EF1 detects an edge.
See the stream documentation for all supported values.

registers.name: STREAM_START_TIME_STAMP
registers.description: When stream is started the value of CORE_TIMER will be saved to this register. The first stream scan occurs one scan period after the time reported by this register.

registers.name: STREAM_AUTORECOVER_DISABLE
registers.description: When the stream buffer becomes full the stream will be stopped. Same behavior as if STREAM_ENABLE is set to zero.

registers.name: STREAM_SCANLIST_ADDRESS#(0:127)
registers.description: A list of addresses to read each scan. In the case of Stream-Out enabled, the list may also include something to write each scan.

registers.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:3)
registers.description: Include one or more of these registers in STREAM_SCANLIST_ADDRESS#(0:127) to trigger stream-out updates.  When added to the scan list these do count against the max scan rate just like normal input addresses, but they do not return any data in the stream read.

registers.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:3)_TARGET
registers.description: Channel that data will be written to.  Before writing data to _BUFFER_###, you must write to _TARGET so the device knows how to interpret and store values.

registers.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:3)_BUFFER_ALLOCATE_NUM_BYTES
registers.description: Size of the buffer in bytes as a power of 2. Should be at least twice the size of updates that will be written and no less than 32. Before writing data to _BUFFER_###, you must write to _BUFFER_ALLOCATE_NUM_BYTES to allocate RAM for the data. Max is 16384.

registers.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:3)_LOOP_NUM_VALUES
registers.description: The number of values, from the end of the array, that will be repeated after reaching the end of supplied data array.

registers.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:3)_SET_LOOP
registers.description:
Controls when new data and loop size are used.
1=Use new data immediately.
2=Wait for synch. New data will not be used until a different stream-out channel is set to Synch.
3=Synch. This stream-out# as well as any stream-outs set to synch will start using new data immediately.

registers.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:3)_BUFFER_STATUS
registers.description: The number of values in the buffer that are not currently being used.

registers.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:3)_ENABLE
registers.description: Write 1 to enable, 0 to disable.  When enabled, you get 1 update per target per stream scan, so a stream must be active for updates to happen.

registers.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:3)_BUFFER_F32
registers.description: Data destination when sending floating point data. Appropriate cal constants are used to convert F32 values to 16-bit binary data, and thus each of these values uses 2 bytes of the stream-out buffer. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:3)_BUFFER_U32
registers.description: Not used at this time.  There are no U32 registers supported in stream-out. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:3)_BUFFER_U16
registers.description: Data destination when sending 16-bit integer data. Each value uses 2 bytes of the stream-out buffer. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: STREAM_DATA_CR
registers.description: Address to read stream data from when operating in C-R mode.

registers.name: STREAM_DATA_CAPTURE_16
registers.description: If a channel produces 32-bits of data the upper 16 will be saved here.

registers.name: STREAM_DEBUG_GET_SELF_INDEX
registers.description: Returns the index of the channel. The index is the position in the scan list that the channel occupies.

registers.name: STREAM_ENABLE
registers.description: Write 1 to start stream. Write 0 to stop stream. Reading this register returns 1 when stream is enabled. When using a triggered stream the stream is considered enabled while waiting for the trigger.

registers.name: SPI_CS_DIONUM
registers.description: The DIO line for Chip-Select.

registers.name: SPI_CLK_DIONUM
registers.description: The DIO line for Clock.

registers.name: SPI_MISO_DIONUM
registers.description: The DIO line for Master-In-Slave-Out.

registers.name: SPI_MOSI_DIONUM
registers.description: The DIO line for Master-Out-Slave-In.

registers.name: SPI_MODE
registers.description:
The SPI mode controls the clock idle state and which edge clocks the data. Bit 1 is CPOL and Bit 0 is CPHA, so CPOL/CPHA for different decimal values:
0 = 0/0 = b00,
1 = 0/1 = b01,
2 = 1/0 = b10,
3 = 1/1 = b11.
For CPOL and CPHA explanations, see Wikipedia article: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_Peripheral_Interface_Bus.

registers.name: SPI_SPEED_THROTTLE
registers.description:
This value controls the SPI clock frequency. Pass 0-65535. Default=0 corresponds to 65536 internally which results in ~800 kHz.
65500 = ~100 kHz,
65100 = ~10 kHz,
61100 = ~1 kHz,
21000 = ~100 Hz,
and 1 = ~67 Hz.
Avoid setting too low such that the entire transaction lasts longer than the 250 millisecond timeout of the internal watchdog timer.

registers.name: SPI_OPTIONS
registers.description:
Bit 0 is Auto-CS-Disable. When bit 0 is 0, CS is enabled. When bit 0 is 1, CS is disabled.
Bit 1: 0 = Set DIO directions before starting the SPI operations, 1 = Do not set DIO directions.
Bit 2: 0 = Transmit data MSB first, 1 = LSB first.
Bits 4-7: This value sets the number of bits that will be transmitted during the last byte of the SPI operation. Default is 8, valid options are 1-8.

registers.name: SPI_GO
registers.description: Write 1 to begin the configured SPI transaction.

registers.name: SPI_NUM_BYTES
registers.description: The number of bytes to transfer.

registers.name: SPI_DATA_TX
registers.description: Write data here. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: SPI_DATA_RX
registers.description: Read data here. This register is a buffer. Underrun behavior - fill with zeros.

registers.name: I2C_SDA_DIONUM
registers.description: The number of the DIO line to be used as the I2C data line. Ex: Writing 0 will force FIO0 to become the I2C-SDA line.

registers.name: I2C_SCL_DIONUM
registers.description: The number of the DIO line to be used as the I2C clock line. Ex: Writing 1 will force FIO1 to become the I2C-SCL line.

registers.name: I2C_SPEED_THROTTLE
registers.description:
This value controls the I2C clock frequency. Pass 0-65535.
Default=0 corresponds to 65536 internally which results in ~450 kHz.
1 results in ~40 Hz, 65516 is ~100 kHz.

registers.name: I2C_OPTIONS
registers.description:
Advanced. Controls details of the I2C protocol to improve device compatibility.
bit 0: 1 = Reset the I2C bus before attempting communication.
bit 1: 0 = Restarts will use a stop and a start, 1 = Restarts will not use a stop.
bit 2: 1 = disable clock stretching.

registers.name: I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS
registers.description: The 7-bit address of the slave device. Value is shifted left by firmware to allow room for the I2C R/W bit.

registers.name: I2C_NUM_BYTES_TX
registers.description: The number of data bytes to transmit. Zero is valid and will result in a read-only I2C operation.

registers.name: I2C_NUM_BYTES_RX
registers.description: The number of data bytes to read. Zero is valid and will result in a write-only I2C operation.

registers.name: I2C_GO
registers.description: Writing to this register will instruct the LabJack to perform an I2C transaction.

registers.name: I2C_ACKS
registers.description: An array of bits used to observe ACKs from the slave device.

registers.name: I2C_DATA_TX
registers.description: Data that will be written to the I2C bus. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: I2C_DATA_RX
registers.description: Data that has been read from the I2C bus. This register is a buffer. Underrun behavior - fill with zeros.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_DQ_DIONUM
registers.description: The data-line DIO number.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_DPU_DIONUM
registers.description: The dynamic pullup control DIO number.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_OPTIONS
registers.description:
Controls advanced features. Value is a bitmask.
bit 0: reserved,
bit 1: reserved,
bit 2: 1=DPU Enabled 0=DPU Disabled,
bit 3: DPU Polarity 1=Active state is high, 0=Active state is low (Dynamic Pull-Up)

registers.name: ONEWIRE_FUNCTION
registers.description:
Set the ROM function to use.
0xF0=Search,
0xCC=Skip,
0x55=Match,
0x33=Read.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_NUM_BYTES_TX
registers.description: Number of data bytes to be sent.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_NUM_BYTES_RX
registers.description: Number of data bytes to be received.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_GO
registers.description: Instructs the T7 to perform the configured 1-wire transaction.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_ROM_MATCH_H
registers.description: Upper 32-bits of the ROM to match.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_ROM_MATCH_L
registers.description: Lower 32-bits of the ROM to match.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_ROM_BRANCHS_FOUND_H
registers.description: Upper 32-bits of the branches detected during a search.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_ROM_BRANCHS_FOUND_L
registers.description: Lower 32-bits of the branches detected during a search.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_SEARCH_RESULT_H
registers.description: Upper 32-bits of the search result.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_SEARCH_RESULT_L
registers.description: Lower 32-bites of the search result.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_PATH_H
registers.description: Upper 32-bits of the path to take during a search.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_PATH_L
registers.description: Lower 32-bits of the path to take during a search.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_DATA_TX
registers.description: Data to be transmitted over the 1-wire bus. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: ONEWIRE_DATA_RX
registers.description: Data received over the 1-wire bus. This register is a buffer. Underrun behavior - buffer is static, old data will fill the extra locations, firmware 1.0225 changes this to read zeros.

registers.name: ASYNCH_ENABLE
registers.description: 1 = Turn on Asynch. Configures timing hardware, DIO lines and allocates the receiving buffer.

registers.name: ASYNCH_BAUD
registers.description: The symbol rate that will be used for communication. 9600 is typical. Up to 38400 works, but heavily loads the T7's processor.

registers.name: ASYNCH_RX_DIONUM
registers.description: The DIO line that will receive data. (RX)

registers.name: ASYNCH_TX_DIONUM
registers.description: The DIO line that will transmit data. (TX)

registers.name: ASYNCH_NUM_DATA_BITS
registers.description: The number of data bits per frame. 0-8, 0=8.

registers.name: ASYNCH_RX_BUFFER_SIZE_BYTES
registers.description: Number of bytes to use for the receiving buffer. Max is 2048. 0 = 200

registers.name: ASYNCH_NUM_BYTES_RX
registers.description: The number of data bytes that have been received.

registers.name: ASYNCH_NUM_BYTES_TX
registers.description: The number of bytes to be transmitted after writing to GO. Max is 256.

registers.name: ASYNCH_TX_GO
registers.description: Write a 1 to this register to initiate a transmission.

registers.name: ASYNCH_NUM_STOP_BITS
registers.description:
The number of stop bits. Values:
1 = one stop bit,
2 = two stop bits,
0 = one stop bit.

registers.name: ASYNCH_PARITY
registers.description:
Parity setting:
0=none,
1=odd,
2=even.

registers.name: ASYNCH_NUM_PARITY_ERRORS
registers.description: The number of parity errors that have been detected. Cleared when UART is enabled. Can also be cleared by writing 0.

registers.name: ASYNCH_DATA_TX
registers.description: Write data to be transmitted here. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: ASYNCH_DATA_RX
registers.description: Read received data from here. This register is a buffer. Underrun behavior - fill with zeros.

registers.name: LUA_RUN
registers.description:
Writing 1 compiles and runs the Lua script that is loaded in RAM. Writing zero stops the script and begins cleaning up memory. Users may poll the register after writing a value of 0 to verify that the VM is unloaded, and garbage collection is complete.
0 = VM fully unloaded.
1 = Running/in-progress

registers.name: LUA_SOURCE_SIZE
registers.description: Allocates RAM for the source code.

registers.name: LUA_SOURCE_WRITE
registers.description: Write the source code here. Source will be saved to the RAM allocated by LUA_SOURCE_SIZE. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: LUA_DEBUG_ENABLE
registers.description: Write 1 to this register to enable debugging.

registers.name: LUA_DEBUG_NUM_BYTES
registers.description: The number of data bytes in the debug buffer waiting to be read.

registers.name: LUA_DEBUG_DATA
registers.description: Read debug data from here. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: LUA_SAVE_TO_FLASH
registers.description: Write 1 to save the loaded source code to flash.

registers.name: LUA_LOAD_SAVED
registers.description: Writing any value reads the script from Flash and loads it into RAM. The script can now be compiled and run.

registers.name: LUA_SAVED_READ_POINTER
registers.description: Address within the saved Lua script in Flash to begin reading from.

registers.name: LUA_SAVED_READ
registers.description: Read script saved to flash from here.

registers.name: LUA_RUN_DEFAULT
registers.description: If set to 1 the script saved in flash will be loaded and run when the LabJack boots up.

registers.name: LUA_DEBUG_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: This is the value that will be loaded into LUA_DEBUG_ENABLE when the LabJack boots up.

registers.name: LUA_DEBUG_NUM_BYTES_DEFAULT
registers.description: This is the value that will be loaded into LUA_DEBUG_NUM_BYTES when the LabJack boots up.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_READ_A
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_READ_B
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_READ_C
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_READ_D
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_INDEX

devices.description: The T4 does not support thermocouple modes.

registers.description:
Specify the desired extended feature for this analog input with the index value. List of index values:
0=None(disabled);
1=Offset and Slope;
3=Max/Min/Avg;
4=Resistance;
5=Average and Threshold;
10=RMS Flex;
11=FlexRMS;
20=Thermocouple type E;
21=Thermocouple type J;
22=Thermocouple type K;
23=Thermocouple type R;
24=Thermocouple type T;
25=Thermocouple type S;
30=Thermocouple type C;
40=RTD model PT100;
41=RTD model PT500;
42=RTD model PT1000.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_CONFIG_A
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_CONFIG_B
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_CONFIG_C
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_CONFIG_D
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_CONFIG_E
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_CONFIG_F
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_CONFIG_G
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_CONFIG_H
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_CONFIG_I
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: AIN#(0:149)_EF_CONFIG_J
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: TDAC#(0:22)
registers.description:
Update a voltage output on a connected LJTick-DAC accessory.
Even TDAC# = DACA,
Odd TDAC# = DACB.
For instance, if LJTick-DAC accessory is connected to FIO2/FIO3 block on main device, TDAC2 corresponds with DACA, and TDAC3 corresponds with DACB.

registers.name: TDAC_SERIAL_NUMBER
registers.description: Returns the serial number of an LJTick-DAC, and forces a re-read of the calibration constants. Which LJTDAC is determined by the last write to TDAC# ... whether it was successful or not.

registers.name: TDAC_SPEED_THROTTLE
registers.description: Sets the I2C clock speed that will be used when communicating with the TDAC. Default value is 65516. See I2C_SPEED_THROTTLE for more detail.

registers.name: SBUS#(0:22)_TEMP
registers.description: Reads temperature in Kelvin from an SBUS sensor (EI-1050/SHT1x/SHT7x).  SBUS# is the DIO line for the EI-1050 enable.  If SBUS# is the same as the value specified for data or clock line, there will be no control of an enable line.

registers.name: SBUS#(0:22)_RH
registers.description: Reads humidity in % from an external SBUS sensor (EI-1050/SHT1x/SHT7x).  # is the DIO line for the EI-1050 enable.  If # is the same as the value specified for data or clock line, there will be no control of an enable line.

registers.name: SBUS#(0:22)_DATA_DIONUM

devices.description: Default = FIO0
Default = FIO4

registers.description: This is the DIO# that the external sensor's data line is connected to.

registers.name: SBUS#(0:22)_CLOCK_DIONUM

devices.description: Default = FIO1
Default = FIO5

registers.description: This is the DIO# that the external sensor's clock line is connected to.

registers.name: SBUS#(0:22)_BACKGROUND_ENABLE
registers.description: Currently unsupported.

registers.name: SBUS_ALL_DATA_DIONUM
registers.description: A write to this global parameter sets all SBUS data line registers to the same value. A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return 0xFF.

registers.name: SBUS_ALL_CLOCK_DIONUM
registers.description: A write to this global parameter sets all SBUS clock line registers to the same value. A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return 0xFF.

registers.name: SBUS_ALL_POWER_DIONUM
registers.description: Sets the power line. This DIO is set to output-high upon any read of SBUS#_TEMP or SBUS#_RH. Default is FIO6 for the T4 and FIO2 for the T7. An FIO line can power up to 4 sensors while an EIO/CIO/MIO line or DAC line can power up to 20 sensors. Set to 9999 to disable. To use multiple power lines, use a DAC line for power, or otherwise control power yourself, set this to 9999 and then control power using writes to normal registers such as FIO5, EIO0, or DAC0.

registers.name: SBUS_ALL_CLOCK_SPEED
registers.description: Sets the clock speed. The clock is software generated so the resulting frequency is not exact. Valid range is 0-65535. Larger values are faster. 0 is the fastest option and is equivalent to 65536. A value of 0 is ~200 kHz. A value of 65000 is ~9.1 kHz.

registers.name: AIN#(0:254)_RANGE

devices.description: Valid values/ranges:  0.0=Default=> 0-2.5 V on LV lines and 10 V on HV lines.

registers.description: The range/span of each analog input. Write the highest expected input voltage.

registers.name: AIN#(0:254)_NEGATIVE_CH

devices.description: For base differential channels, positive must be an even channel from 0-12 and negative must be positive+1.  For extended channels 16-127, see Mux80 datasheet.

registers.description: Specifies the negative channel to be used for each positive channel. 199=Default=> Single-Ended.

registers.name: AIN#(0:254)_RESOLUTION_INDEX

devices.description: Valid values:  0-8 for T7, 0-12 for T7-Pro.  Default value of 0 corresponds to an index of 8 (T7) or 9 (T7-Pro).
Valid values:  0-5.  Default value of 0 corresponds to an index of 5.

registers.description: The resolution index for command-response and AIN-EF readings. A larger resolution index generally results in lower noise and longer sample times.

registers.name: AIN#(0:254)_SETTLING_US

devices.description: 0 = Auto.  Max is 50000 (microseconds).
0 = Auto.  Max is 10000 (microseconds).

registers.description: Settling time for command-response and AIN-EF readings.

registers.name: AIN_ALL_RANGE
registers.description: A write to this global parameter affects all AIN.  A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return -9999.

registers.name: AIN_ALL_NEGATIVE_CH
registers.description: A write to this global parameter affects all AIN. Writing 1 will set all AINs to differential. Writing 199 will set all AINs to single-ended. A read will return 1 if all AINs are set to differential and 199 if all AINs are set to single-ended. If AIN configurations are not consistent 0xFFFF will be returned.

registers.name: AIN_ALL_RESOLUTION_INDEX

devices.description: Valid values:  0-8 for T7, 0-12 for T7-Pro.  Default value of 0 corresponds to an index of 8 (T7) or 9 (T7-Pro).
Valid values:  0-5.  Default value of 0 corresponds to an index of 5.

registers.description: The resolution index for command-response and AIN-EF readings. A larger resolution index generally results in lower noise and longer sample times. A write to this global parameter affects all AIN.  A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return 0xFFFF.

registers.name: AIN_ALL_SETTLING_US

devices.description: 0 = Auto.  Max is 50000 (microseconds).
0 = Auto.  Max is 10000 (microseconds).

registers.description: Settling time for command-response and AIN-EF readings. A write to this global parameter affects all AIN.  A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return -9999. Max is 50,000 us.

registers.name: AIN_ALL_EF_INDEX

devices.description: The T4 does not support thermocouple modes.

registers.description: Write 0 to deactivate AIN_EF on all AINs. No other values may be written to this register. Reads will return the AIN_EF index if all 128 AINs are set to the same value. If values are not the same returns 0xFFFF (65535).

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK0_ENABLE
registers.description: 1 = enabled. 0 = disabled. Must be disabled during configuration.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK0_DIVISOR
registers.description: Divides the core clock. Valid options: 1,2,4,8,16,32,64,256.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK0_OPTIONS
registers.description: Bitmask: bit0: 1 = use external clock. All other bits reserved.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK0_ROLL_VALUE
registers.description: The clock will count to this value and then start over at zero. The clock pulses counted are those after the divisor. 0 results in the max roll value possible. This is a 32-bit value (0-4294967295) if using a 32-bit clock, and a 16-bit value (0-65535) if using a 16-bit clock.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK1_ENABLE
registers.description: 1 = enabled. 0 = disabled. Must be disabled during configuration.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK1_DIVISOR
registers.description: Divides the core clock. Valid options: 1,2,4,8,16,32,64,256.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK1_OPTIONS
registers.description: Bitmask: bit0: 1 = use external clock. All other bits reserved.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK1_ROLL_VALUE
registers.description: The clock will count to this value and then start over at zero. The clock pulses counted are those after the divisor. 0 results in the max roll value possible. This is a 32-bit value (0-4294967295) if using a 32-bit clock, and a 16-bit value (0-65535) if using a 16-bit clock.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK2_ENABLE
registers.description: 1 = enabled. 0 = disabled. Must be disabled during configuration.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK2_DIVISOR
registers.description: Divides the core clock. Valid options: 1,2,4,8,16,32,64,256.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK2_OPTIONS
registers.description: Bitmask: bit0: 1 = use external clock. All other bits reserved.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK2_ROLL_VALUE
registers.description: The clock will count to this value and then start over at zero. The clock pulses counted are those after the divisor. 0 results in the max roll value possible. This is a 32-bit value (0-4294967295) if using a 32-bit clock, and a 16-bit value (0-65535) if using a 16-bit clock.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK0_COUNT
registers.description: Current tick count of this clock.  Will read between 0 and ROLL_VALUE-1.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK1_COUNT
registers.description: Current tick count of this clock.  Will read between 0 and ROLL_VALUE-1.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK2_COUNT
registers.description: Current tick count of this clock.  Will read between 0 and ROLL_VALUE-1.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_ENABLE
registers.description: 1 = enabled. 0 = disabled. Must be disabled during configuration. Note that DIO-EF reads work when disabled and do not return an error.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_INDEX
registers.description: An index to specify the feature you want.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_OPTIONS
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_CONFIG_A
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_CONFIG_B
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_CONFIG_C
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_CONFIG_D
registers.description: Function dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_READ_A
registers.description: Reads an unsigned integer value. The meaning of the integer is dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_READ_A_AND_RESET
registers.description: Reads the same value as DIO#(0:22)_EF_READ_A and forces a reset.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_READ_B
registers.description: Reads an unsigned integer value. The meaning of the integer is dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_READ_A_F
registers.description: Reads a floating point value. The meaning of value is dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_READ_A_F_AND_RESET
registers.description: Reads a floating point value and forces a reset. The meaning of value is dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_READ_B_F
registers.description: Reads a floating point value. The meaning of value is dependent on selected feature index.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_EASY_FREQUENCY_IN
registers.description: Deprecated. Automatically configures the associated DIO_EF for feature index 11. If already configured for index 11, reads the result and resets the DIO_EF.

registers.name: POWER_ETHERNET
registers.description: The current ON/OFF state of the Ethernet module.

registers.name: POWER_WIFI
registers.description: The current ON/OFF state of the WiFi module.

registers.name: POWER_AIN
registers.description: The current ON/OFF state of the analog input module.

registers.name: POWER_LED
registers.description:
Sets the LED operation:
0 = Off. Useful for lower power applications.
1 = normal.
2 = Lower power, LEDs will still blink but will normally be off.
3 = Reserved.
4 = Manual, in this mode the LEDs can be user controlled.

registers.name: POWER_ETHERNET_DEFAULT
registers.description: The ON/OFF state of the Ethernet module after a power-cycle to the device. Provided to optionally reduce power consumption.

registers.name: POWER_WIFI_DEFAULT
registers.description: The ON/OFF state of the WiFi module after a power-cycle to the device. Provided to optionally reduce power consumption.

registers.name: POWER_AIN_DEFAULT
registers.description: The ON/OFF state of the analog input module after a power-cycle to the device. Provided to optionally reduce power consumption.

registers.name: POWER_LED_DEFAULT
registers.description: The ON/OFF state of the LEDs after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: IO_CONFIG_CHECK_FOR_FACTORY
registers.description: Returns 1 if default settings are the same as factory settings.

registers.name: IO_CONFIG_SET_DEFAULT_TO_CURRENT
registers.description: Write a 1 to cause new default (reboot/power-up) values to be saved to flash.  Current values are retrieved and saved as the new defaults. Systems affected: AIN, DIO, DAC, AIN_EF, DIO_EF.

registers.name: IO_CONFIG_SET_DEFAULT_TO_FACTORY
registers.description: Write a 1 to cause new default (reboot/power-up) values to be saved to flash.  Factory values are retrieved and saved as the new defaults. Systems affected: AIN, DIO, DAC, AIN_EF, DIO_EF.

registers.name: IO_CONFIG_CURRENT_CRC32
registers.description: Collects the current IO configuration and calculates of a CRC32.

registers.name: CLEANSE
registers.description: Writing 0x5317052E to this register will trigger a system cleanse.

registers.name: CORE_TIMER
registers.description: Internal 32-bit system timer running at 1/2 core speed, thus normally 80M/2 => 40 MHz.

registers.name: SYSTEM_TIMER_20HZ
registers.description: Internal 32-bit system timer running at 20Hz.

registers.name: SPC_FREQUENCY_OUT_ENABLE_DEPRECATED
registers.description: This has been deprecated in favor of DAC1_FREQUENCY_OUT_ENABLE. 0 = off, 1 = output 10 Hz signal on SPC. Note that stream uses SPC for a timing output, so if you use this while streaming you will get a lot more counts.

registers.name: DAC1_FREQUENCY_OUT_ENABLE
registers.description: 0 = off, 1 = output 10 Hz signal on DAC1. Note that writing to DAC1 or enabling a stream out which is targeting DAC1 will disable this feature.

registers.name: WAIT_US_BLOCKING
registers.description: Delays for x microseconds. Range is 0-100000.

registers.name: IO_CONFIG_SET_CURRENT_TO_FACTORY
registers.description: Write a 1 to set current values to factory configuration.  The factory values are retrieved from flash and written to the current configuration registers. Systems affected: AIN, DIO, DAC, AIN_EF, DIO_EF.

registers.name: IO_CONFIG_SET_CURRENT_TO_DEFAULT
registers.description: Write a 1 to set current values to default configuration.  The default values are retrieved from flash and written to the current configuration registers, thus this behaves similar to reboot/power-up. Systems affected: AIN, DIO, DAC, AIN_EF, DIO_EF.

registers.name: SYSTEM_REBOOT
registers.description: Issues a device reboot. Must write 0x4C4Axxxx, where xxxx is number of 50ms ticks to wait before reboot.  To reboot immediately write 0x4C4A0000 (d1279918080).

registers.name: TEMPERATURE_AIR_K
registers.description: Returns the estimated ambient air temperature just outside of the device in its red plastic enclosure.  This register is equal to TEMPERATURE_DEVICE_K - 4.3.  If Ethernet and/or WiFi is enabled, subtract an extra 0.6 for each.

registers.name: TEMPERATURE_DEVICE_K

devices.description: The internal temperature sensor, AIN14, is internally connected to an LM94021 (U24) with GS=10 which is physically located on the bottom of the PCB between the AIN0/1 and AIN2/3 screw-terminals.

The internal temperature sensor is internally connected to an LM94021 (U24) with GS=10 which is physically located on the top of the PCB behind the VS screw terminal of the FIO4 and FIO5 screw terminal block.

registers.description: Takes a reading from the internal temperature sensor using range=+/-10V and resolution=8, and applies the formula Volts*-92.6+467.6 to return kelvins.

registers.name: SNTP_UPDATE_INTERVAL
registers.description: Sets the SNTP retry time in seconds. A value of zero will disable SNTP(0=default). Values must be 10 or greater.

registers.name: RTC_TIME_S
registers.description: Read the current time in seconds since Jan, 1970, aka Epoch or Unix time. This value is calculated from the 80 MHz crystal, not the RTC 32 kHz crystal. Non-pro devices do not have a real time clock, so the reported time is either seconds since device startup or the time reported by the network time protocol over Ethernet. Pro devices have a real time clock that will be used to initialize this register at startup, the time can then be updated by NTP.

registers.name: SYSTEM_COUNTER_10KHZ
registers.description: A 10 kHz counter synchronized to RTC_TIME_S. This register can be appended to RTC_TIME_S as the decimal portion to get 0.1 ms resolution.

registers.name: RTC_SET_TIME_S
registers.description: Write a new timestamp to the RTC in seconds since Jan, 1970, aka Epoch or Unix timestamp.

registers.name: RTC_SET_TIME_SNTP
registers.description: Write any value to instruct the T7 to update its clock from a SNTP server. Requires that SNTP_UPDATE_INTERVAL is non-zero.

registers.name: RTC_TIME_CALENDAR
registers.description: Read six consecutive addresses of type UINT16, starting with this address. The result will be in year, month, day, hour, minute, second calendar format. i.e. [2014, 10, 21, 18, 55, 35]

registers.name: ETHERNET_IP
registers.description: Read the current IP address of wired Ethernet.

registers.name: ETHERNET_SUBNET
registers.description: Read the current subnet of wired Ethernet.

registers.name: ETHERNET_GATEWAY
registers.description: Read the current gateway of wired Ethernet.

registers.name: ETHERNET_DNS
registers.description: Read the current DNS of wired Ethernet.

registers.name: ETHERNET_ALTDNS
registers.description: Read the current Alt DNS of wired Ethernet.

registers.name: ETHERNET_DHCP_ENABLE
registers.description: Read the current Enabled/Disabled state of Ethernet DHCP.

registers.name: ETHERNET_IP_DEFAULT
registers.description: The IP address of wired Ethernet after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_SUBNET_DEFAULT
registers.description: The subnet of wired Ethernet after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_GATEWAY_DEFAULT
registers.description: The gateway of wired Ethernet after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_DNS_DEFAULT
registers.description: The DNS of wired Ethernet after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_ALTDNS_DEFAULT
registers.description: The Alt DNS of wired Ethernet after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_DHCP_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: The Enabled/Disabled state of Ethernet DHCP after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_APPLY_SETTINGS
registers.description: Writing 1 to this register power-cycles Ethernet.  It tells the device to waits 1s before turning off Ethernet and then 500ms before turning it back on.

registers.name: WIFI_IP
registers.description: Read the current IP address of WiFi.

registers.name: WIFI_SUBNET
registers.description: Read the current subnet of WiFi.

registers.name: WIFI_GATEWAY
registers.description: Read the current gateway of WiFi.

registers.name: WIFI_DHCP_ENABLE
registers.description: Read the current Enabled/Disabled state of WiFi DHCP.

registers.name: WIFI_SSID
registers.description: Read the current SSID (network name) of WiFi

registers.name: WIFI_IP_DEFAULT
registers.description: The new IP address of WiFi. Use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS.

registers.name: WIFI_SUBNET_DEFAULT
registers.description: The new subnet of WiFi.  Use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS.

registers.name: WIFI_GATEWAY_DEFAULT
registers.description: The new gateway of WiFi. Use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS.

registers.name: WIFI_DHCP_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: The new Enabled/Disabled state of WiFi DHCP. Use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS

registers.name: WIFI_SSID_DEFAULT
registers.description: The new SSID (network name) of WiFi. Use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS.

registers.name: WIFI_PASSWORD_DEFAULT
registers.description: Write the password for the WiFi network, then use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS.

registers.name: WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS
registers.description: Apply all new WiFi settings: IP, Subnet, Gateway, DHCP, SSID, Password. 1=Apply

registers.name: WIFI_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_TO_VERSIONX
registers.description: Start an update by using USB or Ethernet to write the desired version to update to.

registers.name: WIFI_STATUS
registers.description: Status Codes: ASSOCIATED = 2900, ASSOCIATING = 2901, ASSOCIATION_FAILED = 2902, UNPOWERED = 2903, BOOTING = 2904, START_FAILED = 2905, APPLYING_SETTINGS = 2906, DHCP_STARTED = 2907, OTHER = 2909

registers.name: WIFI_RSSI
registers.description: WiFi RSSI (signal strength).  Typical values are -40 for very good, and -75 for very weak.  The T7 microcontroller only gets a new RSSI value from the WiFi module when WiFi communication occurs.

registers.name: WIFI_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_STATUS
registers.description: CONFIGURING = 2920, IN_PROGRESS = 2921, REBOOTING = 2923, UPDATE_SUCCESS = 2924, UPDATE_FAILED = 2925

registers.name: AIN#(0:254)_BINARY
registers.description: Returns the 24-bit binary representation of the specified analog input. If you prefer 16-bit representation, simply divide this by 256. This is for command-response only.  Stream always returns binary and LJM applies cal constants, so the LJM config flag LJM_STREAM_AIN_BINARY is used to get binary values.

registers.name: DAC#(0:1)_BINARY
registers.description: Writes binary values to the DACs. 0 = lowest output, 65535 = highest output.

registers.name: USER_RAM#(0:39)_F32
registers.description: Generic RAM registers. Useful for passing data between a host computer and a Lua script. Will not return an error if alternate data types are used.

registers.name: USER_RAM#(0:9)_I32
registers.description: Generic RAM registers. Useful for passing data between a host computer and a Lua script. Will not return an error if alternate data types are used.

registers.name: USER_RAM#(0:39)_U32
registers.description: Generic RAM registers. Useful for passing data between a host computer and a Lua script. Will not return an error if alternate data types are used.

registers.name: USER_RAM#(0:19)_U16
registers.description: Generic RAM registers. Useful for passing data between a host computer and a Lua script. Will not return an error if alternate data types are used.

registers.name: USER_RAM_FIFO#(0:3)_DATA_U16
registers.description: Generic FIFO buffer.  Useful for passing ORDERED or SEQUENTIAL data between various endpoints, such as between a host and a Lua script. Use up to 4 FIFO buffers simultaneously->1 of each data type, all 4 different data types, or a mixture. e.g. FIFO0_DATA_U16 points to the same memory as other FIFO0 registers, such that there are a total of 4 memory blocks: FIFO0, FIFO1, FIFO2 and FIFO3.  It is possible to write into a FIFO buffer using a different datatype than is being used to read out of it. This register is a buffer. Underrun behavior - throws an error.

registers.name: USER_RAM_FIFO#(0:3)_DATA_U32
registers.description: Generic FIFO buffer.  Useful for passing ORDERED or SEQUENTIAL data between various endpoints, such as between a host and a Lua script. Use up to 4 FIFO buffers simultaneously->1 of each data type, all 4 different data types, or a mixture. e.g. FIFO0_DATA_U16 points to the same memory as other FIFO0 registers, such that there are a total of 4 memory blocks: FIFO0, FIFO1, FIFO2 and FIFO3.  It is possible to write into a FIFO buffer using a different datatype than is being used to read out of it. This register is a buffer. Underrun behavior - throws an error.

registers.name: USER_RAM_FIFO#(0:3)_DATA_I32
registers.description: Generic FIFO buffer.  Useful for passing ORDERED or SEQUENTIAL data between various endpoints, such as between a host and a Lua script. Use up to 4 FIFO buffers simultaneously->1 of each data type, all 4 different data types, or a mixture. e.g. FIFO0_DATA_U16 points to the same memory as other FIFO0 registers, such that there are a total of 4 memory blocks: FIFO0, FIFO1, FIFO2 and FIFO3.  It is possible to write into a FIFO buffer using a different datatype than is being used to read out of it. This register is a buffer. Underrun behavior - throws an error.

registers.name: USER_RAM_FIFO#(0:3)_DATA_F32
registers.description: Generic FIFO buffer.  Useful for passing ORDERED or SEQUENTIAL data between various endpoints, such as between a host and a Lua script. Use up to 4 FIFO buffers simultaneously->1 of each data type, all 4 different data types, or a mixture. e.g. FIFO0_DATA_U16 points to the same memory as other FIFO0 registers, such that there are a total of 4 memory blocks: FIFO0, FIFO1, FIFO2 and FIFO3.  It is possible to write into a FIFO buffer using a different datatype than is being used to read out of it. This register is a buffer. Underrun behavior - throws an error.

registers.name: USER_RAM_FIFO#(0:3)_ALLOCATE_NUM_BYTES
registers.description: Allocate memory for a FIFO buffer. Number of bytes should be sufficient to store users max transfer array size.  Note that FLOAT32, INT32, and UINT32 require 4 bytes per value, and UINT16 require 2 bytes per value. Maximum size is limited by available memory. Care should be taken to conserve enough memory for other operations such as AIN_EF, Lua, Stream etc.

registers.name: USER_RAM_FIFO#(0:3)_NUM_BYTES_IN_FIFO
registers.description: Poll this register to see when new data is available/ready. Each read of the FIFO buffer decreases this value, and each write to the FIFO buffer increases this value. At any point in time, the following equation holds: Nbytes = Nwritten - Nread.

registers.name: USER_RAM_FIFO#(0:3)_EMPTY
registers.description: Write any value to this register to efficiently empty, flush, or otherwise clear data from the FIFO.

registers.name: TEST
registers.description: A read of this test register should always return 0x00112233 or d1122867. If your software has the word swap quirk, you will incorrectly read 0x22330011 or 573767697.  If your software has the address-1 quirk, a UINT16 (1-register) read from 55101 will incorrectly return 0x0011 (should read 0x2233).  This register is unlike others, in that it allows you can read a single word from 55100 or 55101, or of course 2 words from 55100.

registers.name: TEST_UINT16
registers.description: Write a value and read back to test UINT16 operation. Default is 0x0011 or d17.

registers.name: TEST_UINT32
registers.description: Write a value and read back to test UINT32 operation. Default is 0x00112233 or d1122867. If your software has the word swap quirk, the default will incorrectly read 0x22330011 or 573767697.

registers.name: TEST_INT32
registers.description: Write a value and read back to test INT32 operation. Default is 0x8899AABB or d-2003195205. If your software has the word swap quirk, the default will incorrectly read 0xAABB8899 or -1430550375.

registers.name: TEST_FLOAT32
registers.description: Write a value and read back to test FLOAT32 operation. Default is 0xC61C3C00 or -9999.0. If your software has the word swap quirk, the default will incorrectly read 0x3C00C61C or 0.00786.

registers.name: PRODUCT_ID
registers.description: The numeric identifier of the device.  Such as 7 for a T7 / T7-Pro.

registers.name: HARDWARE_VERSION
registers.description: The hardware version of the device.

registers.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION
registers.description: The current firmware version installed on the main processor.

registers.name: BOOTLOADER_VERSION
registers.description: The bootloader version installed on the main processor.

registers.name: WIFI_VERSION
registers.description: The current firmware version of the WiFi module, if available.

registers.name: HARDWARE_INSTALLED
registers.description:
Bitmask indicating installed hardware options.
bit0: High Resolution ADC,
bit1: WiFi,
bit2: RTC,
bit3: microSD.

registers.name: ETHERNET_MAC
registers.description: The MAC address of the wired Ethernet module.

registers.name: WIFI_MAC
registers.description: The MAC address of the WiFi module.

registers.name: SERIAL_NUMBER
registers.description: The serial number of the device.

registers.name: DEVICE_NAME_DEFAULT
registers.description: Reads return the current device name. Writes update the default and current device name. A reboot is necessary to update the name reported by NBNS. Up to 49 characters, cannot contain periods.

registers.name: CURRENT_SOURCE_10UA_CAL_VALUE
registers.description: Fixed current source value in Amps for the 10UA terminal. This value is stored during factory calibration, it is not a current reading. Using the equation V=IR, with a known current and voltage, it is possible to calculate resistance of RTDs.

registers.name: CURRENT_SOURCE_200UA_CAL_VALUE
registers.description: Fixed current source value in Amps for the 200UA terminal. This value is stored during factory calibration, it is not a current reading. Using the equation V=IR, with a known current and voltage, it is possible to calculate resistance of RTDs.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DIR_CHANGE
registers.description: Write any value to this register to change the current working directory (CWD). Must first designate which directory to open by writing to FILE_IO_PATH_WRITE_LEN_BYTES then FILE_IO_PATH_WRITE.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DIR_CURRENT
registers.description: Write any value to this register to load the current working directory into FILE_IO_PATH_READ, and its length into FILE_IO_PATH_READ_LEN_BYTES. Can be used to identify current position in a file tree.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DIR_MAKE
registers.description: Unimplemented.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DIR_REMOVE
registers.description: Unimplemented.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DIR_FIRST
registers.description:
Write any value to this register to initiate iteration through files and directories in the CWD. Typical sequence:
FILE_IO_DIR_FIRST(W), then loop through: [FILE_IO_NAME_READ_LEN(R), FILE_IO_NAME_READ(R), FILE_IO_ATTRIBUTES(R), FILE_IO_SIZE_BYTES(R), FILE_IO_DIR_NEXT(W)]
..until any of the following errors:
FILE_IO_END_OF_CWD (2966), FILE_IO_INVALID_OBJECT (2809), or FILE_IO_NOT_FOUND (2960).

registers.name: FILE_IO_DIR_NEXT
registers.description: Write any value to this register to continue iteration through files and directories in the CWD.

registers.name: FILE_IO_OPEN
registers.description: Write any value to this register to open a file. Must first designate which file to open by writing to FILE_IO_PATH_WRITE_LEN_BYTES then FILE_IO_PATH_WRITE.

registers.name: FILE_IO_CLOSE
registers.description: Write any value to this register to close the open file.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DELETE
registers.description: Write any value to this register to delete the active file. Must first designate which file to delete by writing to FILE_IO_PATH_WRITE_LEN_BYTES then FILE_IO_PATH_WRITE.

registers.name: FILE_IO_ATTRIBUTES
registers.description:
Used to differentiate files from directories/folders.
Bitmask:
Bit0: Reserved,
Bit1: Reserved,
Bit2: Reserved,
Bit3: Reserved,
Bit4: 1=Directory,
Bit5: 1=File.

registers.name: FILE_IO_SIZE_BYTES
registers.description: The size of the file in bytes. Directories have 0 size.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DISK_SECTOR_SIZE_BYTES
registers.description: The size of each sector in the SD card in bytes. In Windows this is called the Allocation Size.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DISK_SECTORS_PER_CLUSTER
registers.description: The number of sectors in each cluster. Captured on read of FILE_IO_DISK_SECTOR_SIZE_BYTES.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DISK_TOTAL_CLUSTERS
registers.description: The total number of clusters in the SD card. Captured on read of FILE_IO_DISK_SECTOR_SIZE_BYTES.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DISK_FREE_CLUSTERS
registers.description: Free (available) clusters in the SD card. Used to determine free space. Captured on read of FILE_IO_DISK_SECTOR_SIZE_BYTES.

registers.name: FILE_IO_DISK_FORMAT_INDEX
registers.description:
Used to determine the format of the SD card.
0=None or Unknown,
1=FAT12,
2=FAT16(Windows FAT),
3=FAT32

registers.name: FILE_IO_PATH_WRITE_LEN_BYTES
registers.description: Write the length (in bytes) of the file path or directory to access.

registers.name: FILE_IO_PATH_READ_LEN_BYTES
registers.description: Read the length (in bytes) of the next file path or directory to access.

registers.name: FILE_IO_PATH_WRITE
registers.description: Write the desired file path. Must first write the length of the file path string (in bytes) to FILE_IO_PATH_WRITE_LEN_BYTES. File paths should be null terminated. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: FILE_IO_PATH_READ
registers.description: Read the next file path in the CWD. Length of the string (in bytes) determined by FILE_IO_PATH_READ_LEN_BYTES. File paths will be null terminated. This register is a buffer. Underrun behavior - fill with zeros.

registers.name: FILE_IO_WRITE
registers.description: Unimplemented. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: FILE_IO_READ
registers.description: Read the contents of a file. Must first write to FILE_IO_OPEN. Size of the file (in bytes) determined by FILE_IO_SIZE_BYTES. This register is a buffer. Underrun behavior - throws an error.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Write a 1 to enable the watchdog or a 0 to disable.  The watchdog must be disabled before writing any of the other watchdog registers (except for WATCHDOG_STRICT_CLEAR).

registers.name: WATCHDOG_ADVANCED_DEFAULT
registers.description: A single binary-encoded value where each bit is an advanced option. If bit 0 is set, IO_CONFIG_SET_CURRENT_TO_FACTORY will be done on timeout.  If bit 1 is set, IO_CONFIG_SET_CURRENT_TO_DEFAULT will be done on timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT_S_DEFAULT
registers.description: When the device receives any communication over USB/Ethernet/WiFi, the watchdog timer is cleared.  If the watchdog timer is not cleared within the timeout period, the enabled actions will be done.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_STARTUP_DELAY_S_DEFAULT
registers.description: This specifies the initial timeout period at device bootup.  This is used until the first time the watchdog is cleared or timeout ... after that the normal timeout is used.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_STRICT_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Set to 1 to enable strict mode.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_STRICT_KEY_DEFAULT
registers.description: When set to strict mode, this is the value that must be written to the clear register.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_STRICT_CLEAR
registers.description: When running in strict mode, writing the key to this register is the only way to clear the watchdog. Writing to this register while not using strict mode will clear the watchdog.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_RESET_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Timeout action:  Set to 1 to enable device-reset on watchdog timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DIO_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Timeout action:  Set to 1 to enable DIO update on watchdog timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DIO_STATE_DEFAULT
registers.description: The state high/low of the digital I/O after a Watchdog timeout. See DIO_STATE

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DIO_DIRECTION_DEFAULT
registers.description: The direction input/output of the digital I/O after a Watchdog timeout. See DIO_DIRECTION

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DIO_INHIBIT_DEFAULT
registers.description: The inhibit mask of the digital I/O after a Watchdog timeout. See DIO_INHIBIT

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DAC0_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Timeout action:  Set to 1 to enable DAC0 update on watchdog timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DAC0_DEFAULT
registers.description: The voltage of DAC0 after a Watchdog timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DAC1_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Timeout action:  Set to 1 to enable DAC1 update on watchdog timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DAC1_DEFAULT
registers.description: The voltage of DAC1 after a Watchdog timeout.

registers.name: INTERNAL_FLASH_KEY
registers.description: Sets the region of internal flash to which access is allowed.

registers.name: INTERNAL_FLASH_READ_POINTER
registers.description: The address in internal flash that reads will start from.

registers.name: INTERNAL_FLASH_READ
registers.description: Data read from internal flash.

registers.name: INTERNAL_FLASH_ERASE
registers.description: Erases a 4k section of internal flash starting at the specified address. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: INTERNAL_FLASH_WRITE_POINTER
registers.description: Address in internal flash where writes will begin.

registers.name: INTERNAL_FLASH_WRITE
registers.description: Data written here will be written to internal flash. This register is a buffer.

registers.name: DGT_TEMPERATURE_LATEST_RAW
registers.description: Get the latest temperature conversion, and begin a new conversion. Starting with FW1.21, temperature conversion is instantaneous. Units are described in TMP112 datasheet.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_RAW
registers.description: Craw. Get a new humidity reading from HCH-1000. Units are in 100s fF of capacitance.

registers.name: DGT_LIGHT_RAW
registers.description: Counts. Get a new light reading from LED. Units are in counts before reverse leakage complete.

registers.name: DGT_CHANGE_LOG_ITEMS
registers.description:
Set the items to log. Value is a bitmask:
Bit0: 1 = Log Temperature,
Bit1: 1 = Log Light,
Bit2: 1 = Log Humidity.
All other bits reserved. Change implemented on next erase of dataset.

registers.name: DGT_LOG_ITEMS_DATASET
registers.description:
Read what is logged in the dataset. Value is a bitmask:
Bit0: 1 = Temperature logged,
Bit1: 1 = Light logged,
Bit2: 1 = Humidity logged.
In memory: T, TL, TH, THL.

registers.name: DGT_CHANGE_LOG_INTERVAL_INDEX
registers.description:
Set the time interval between log events. Index
0=10s,
1=30s,
2=1m,
3=10m,
4=30m,
5=1h,
6=6h
Change implemented on next erase of dataset.

registers.name: DGT_LOG_INTERVAL_INDEX_DATASET
registers.description:
Read time interval between log events in the dataset. Index
0=10s,
1=30s,
2=1m,
3=10m,
4=30m,
5=1h,
6=6h

registers.name: DGT_LOG_START_TIME
registers.description: The start time of the logging session: 22042 Year=0 to 99, 22043 Month=1 to 12, 22044 Day=1 to 31, 22045 Weekday=1 to 7, 22046 Hour=0 to 23, 22047 Minutes=0 to 59, 22048 Second=0 to 59

registers.name: DGT_nALARM_FLAGS
registers.description: A bitmask of all alarm and error flags. 0=Occurred, 1=Did NOT occur. Refer to documentation for more information

registers.name: DGT_nTRIG_HIGH_ALARM
registers.description: User high threshold alarm triggered. 0=Occurred, 1=Did NOT occur

registers.name: DGT_nTRIG_LOW_ALARM
registers.description: User low threshold alarm triggered. 0=Occurred, 1=Did NOT occur

registers.name: DGT_nALARM_ARMED
registers.description: User alarms armed flag. 0=Armed, 1=Not yet armed

registers.name: DGT_INDEX_ALARM_ITEM
registers.description: Index of the user alarm item. 0=None, 1=Temperature, 2=Light, 3=Humidity. Valid results require that the corresponding item is being logged.

registers.name: DGT_INDEX_ALARM_ARM_CONDITION
registers.description: Index of the alarm arming condition. 0=Arm once within threshold window, 1=Arm after pure time delay

registers.name: DGT_HIGH_ALARM_ENABLE
registers.description: User high threshold alarm enable. 0=Disabled, 1=Enabled

registers.name: DGT_LOW_ALARM_ENABLE
registers.description: User low threshold alarm enable. 0=Disabled, 1=Enabled

registers.name: DGT_ALARM_ARM_DELAY
registers.description: User threshold alarm arming delay counter. The number of consecutive readings (inside window) before arming the alarm-> 0 to 63

registers.name: DGT_ALARM_TRIG_DELAY
registers.description: User threshold alarm trigger delay counter. The number of consecutive readings outside window before triggering the alarm-> 0 to 31

registers.name: DGT_HIGH_ALARM_THRESHOLD
registers.description: User alarm high threshold value. Value depends on which item is being alarmed on(T, L, or H).

registers.name: DGT_LOW_ALARM_THRESHOLD
registers.description: User alarm low threshold value. Value depends on which item is being alarmed on(T, L, or H).

registers.name: DGT_pHIGH_THRESH_LIGHT
registers.description: High light threshold pointer(because light alarms require an array of count values)-> 0 to 255. Auto-incremented

registers.name: DGT_HIGH_THRESH_LIGHT
registers.description: High light threshold array start.

registers.name: DGT_pLOW_THRESH_LIGHT
registers.description: Low light threshold pointer(because light alarms require an array of count values)-> 0 to 255. Auto-incremented

registers.name: DGT_LOW_THRESH_LIGHT
registers.description: Low light threshold array start.

registers.name: DGT_INSTALLED_OPTIONS
registers.description: Number of things installed on the Digit 2=TL, 3=TLH

registers.name: DGT_STORED_BYTES
registers.description: Number of bytes of data stored on flash.

registers.name: DGT_LIFETIME_READINGS
registers.description: Total number of readings saved since last cleared. Typically cleared if new battery is installed.

registers.name: DGT_BATTERY_INSTALL_DATE
registers.description: The date that the battery was installed. Timestamp format = Seconds since 1970. This parameter is used to estimate remaining battery life.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_OFFSET_FACTORY
registers.description: The factory calibration offset which can be used in the conversion of raw humidity. Write requires unlocked.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_OFFSET
registers.description: A single point offset used in the conversion of raw humidity. Units in 100s fF

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_I_SOURCE
registers.description: Read=Constant current source trim value. Write(any value)=Automatically calibrate the current source. The current source is used for humidity readings, and once calibrated, it will not need to be calibrated again.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_SLOPE_FACTORY
registers.description: The factory slope of humidity which can be used in the conversion of raw humidity. Units in %Rh per 100s fF. Write requires unlocked.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_SLOPE
registers.description: The slope of humidity used in the conversion of raw humidity. Units in %Rh per 100s fF.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_T_SLOPE
registers.description: The temperature dependent factor used in the conversion of raw humidity. Units in 100s fF per degC

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_T_SLOPE_FACTORY
registers.description: The factory temperature dependent factor used in the conversion of raw humidity. Units in 100s fF per degC

registers.name: DGT_RTCC_TIME
registers.description: The current time of the real-time-clock on the Digit. Synchronized with the computer within software. 22242 Year=0 to 99, 22243 Month=1 to 12, 22244 Day=1 to 31, 22245 Weekday=1 to 7, 22246 Hour=0 to 23, 22247 Minutes=0 to 59, 22248 Second=0 to 59

registers.name: DGT_FLASH_WIP
registers.description: A status flag for the flash(data storage chip) on the Digit. 1=Write in-progress, 0=Idle

registers.name: DGT_pFLASH_READ
registers.description: The read pointer for flash. Auto-incremented, simply initialize with a start address, then use 22812+

registers.name: DGT_FLASH_READ
registers.description: Read data from this address and subsequent addresses after pointer is initialized. Used to download data from the Digit.

registers.name: DGT_FLASH_bkERASE
registers.description: Erase all data on the flash. KEY=Erase, Other=No effect, KEY=37157 Takes 5 seconds to complete, so poll the WIP status flag until =0. After erase, logging will begin immediately.

registers.name: DGT_pFLASH_WRITE
registers.description: The write pointer for flash. Auto-incremented, simply initialize with a start address, then use 22832+

registers.name: DGT_FLASH_WRITE
registers.description: Write data to this address and subsequent addresses after pointer is initialized. Used primarily for firmware updates.

registers.name: DGT_FACTORY_UNLOCK
registers.description: Write a unique passkey to unlock factory settings. Only used by mfr.

registers.name: DGT_REQ_FW_UPDATE
registers.description: Request a firmware update.  Pass a value of 150 (5mS) so that the Digit has time to de-enumerate. Only used by mfr.

registers_beta.name: LUA_NUM_IO_FLOATS
registers_beta.description: Deprecated. Do not need to use this in FW 1.0163+, as 200 bytes of USER_RAM are pre-allocated. Allocates memory for x input-output floats in FW<1.0163.

registers_beta.name: FILE_IO_LUA_SWITCH_FILE
registers_beta.description: Write any value to this register to instruct Lua scripts to switch to a new file. Lua script should periodically check LJ.CheckFileFlag() to receive instruction, then call LJ.ClearFileFlag() after file switch is complete. Useful for applications that require continuous logging in a Lua script, and on-demand file access from a host.

registers_beta.name: BATTERY_RAM#(0:16)
registers_beta.description: Saves or recalls data to or from the battery-backed SRAM. Only available on T7-Pros.
